description: see the description section below this summary
full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement
### Valve Assembly, Oxygen System

#### Call for Proposals

**Solicitation Number:** W8485-258479/A

**Notice Release Date:** November 20, 2024

**Tender Closing Date:** December 20, 2024, 14:00:00 hours

The Government of Canada is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the procurement of Valve Assembly, Oxygen System. The contract is sought to meet the needs of the Department of National Defence.

**Scope of Work**

The requirement is for 20 units of the specified item, as outlined below:

* Item 1: Valve Assembly, Oxygen System (OEM Part No.: 27660-3, NCAGE: 53655)
* Quantity: 20 units
* Unit of Issue: Each
* Delivery Location: 25 CFSD Montreal
* Delivery Date: By March 31, 2025

**Tender Evaluation Criteria**

Proposals will be evaluated based on the lowest price for the specified quantities of items listed above. Equivalent or substitute products must be clearly identified in the proposal, including the brand name and model, and/or the part number and NCAGE.

**Terms and Conditions**

* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Key Contact Information**

To receive any clarification or submit additional information, please contact:

* Dany Lebel
* Email: [dany.lebel2@forces.gc.ca](mailto:dany.lebel2@forces.gc.ca)
* Phone: (000) 000-0000
* Address: 101 Colonel By Dr, Ottawa, ON, K1A 0K2, Canada

**Compliance Information**

* Firms must be able to provide proof of certification for the quality management systems, as outlined in the RFP package.
* The requirement falls under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
* The procurement is open to all interested firms.

**Documents**

The RFP package can be accessed through the Canada Business Network website: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca)

To submit online quotes electronically, use the epost Connect service. Make sure to follow the instructions outlined in the RFP. The National Embarkation and Escort Squadron is required to take extraordinary measures to avoid extraordinary back-orders on its essential equipment. Therefore, the deadline is subject to variation.
